newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing share market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing share market report.

text.p: Dutch shares set a new closing high, but with little conviction, as prices moved in a narrow band in light volume and faded towards the end of the session.
The AEX index of 25 blue chips closed 0.55 points or 0.10 percent higher at 571.92, beating the previous all-time closing high of 571.76 set on June 6 by a narrow margin of 0.16 points.

Shares of paper, packaging and office supplies group KNP BT rose sharply in the morning on hopes that the company might be about to sell off its loss-making paper business. But the shares quickly reversed their gains and closed 0.20 guilders lower at 41.40 after the company said a partnership was more likely.
"The whole thing is far less spectacular than it seems at first sight," said Wijgert Verstoep of MeesPierson after attending a company briefing for analysts.
Dealers said Dutch share prices were likely to drift sideways in coming sessions as investors wait for lower prices or hard evidence of a firm uptrend before entering the market.
The AMX index of 25 medium-size or mid-cap companies outperformed its big brother, the AEX, rising 8.56 points or 0.98 percent to 886.18.
Dealers said AMX stocks were probably supported by the launch of Kempen & Co's 210-million-guilder Orange Midcap Fund.
